data.details: Notary Public Andrea Clark will notarize mail-in and absentee ballots beginning at 5:30.  The Mound City Slickers will perform from 6 p.m. until dark.  Bring a lawn chair, beverage, ballot and I.D. to Bellerive Blvd.
data.location: 911 Bellerive Blvd., St. Louis MO, MO 63111

data.details: Middendorf-Kredell Library

We are hosting voter registration and ballot notarization services at the museum on Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays from September 17–October 10, but would like to expand through October 24. We're just looking for help on the Saturday shifts

Our notary effort will be at 10 libraries in metro St. Louis: Schlafly, Barr, Julia Davis and Carpenter in STL City; Headquarters, Weber Road, Prairie Village and Natural Bridge; and University City and Ferguson independent branches. We will be there during regular business hours from October 19-29 (except Sundays). We will be adhering to all safety protocols established by the libraries.
data.location: 295 N. Lindbergh Blvd., St. Louis, MO 63141

data.details: Notary will be set up on the patio under an umbrella
data.location: 1629 Tower Grove Ave, St. Louis, MO 63110

data.details: Table and two chairs provided inside the space, and everyone inside is required to wear a mask and sanitize at the door. (All carryout or curbside pickup). Outside bistro tables are available if the notary prefers.

The space has a glass door with a mail slot. The notary can sit inside and review ID and such through the glass without direct contact. The ballot/journal can be pushed through the slot and returned to the voter the same way, so no contact!

Notary will setup in our outdoor patio space, spaced over 10 ft away from any customer's tables. Notary will sit opposite a large picnic table. Guests using the notary service will check in with our host, and will be sent over to the notary one at a time.
Notary will be set up on the patio under an umbrella
data.location: 1629 Tower Grove Ave, St. Louis, MO 63110

data.details: We will provide a table, hand sanitizer and pens. All customers must wear a mask to enter, and apply hand sanitizer to ensure the safety of everyone.
